It's true. I wasn't able to find this show the big bang theory funny until I went to school and studied theoretical physics for 8 years. I used to watch it in highschool but I never really understood the humour in it that my classmates did (I was never the smartest in the class, at that time I must add). So I began to work my ass off, studying under Mr. Einstein himself to figure out some of the biggest unanswered questions of the world; "What exactly makes a dank meme?", "What makes Sheldon such a smart and funny character?", "Why are all engineers Jews?". It wasn't until my thesis when I was doing some light reading on string theory (I already memorized all written literature on the topic at the time, I guess you could just say I was bored) when I began to piece it all together. I don't really know how to explain it to anyone else, because my heightened sense of intelligence was able to grasp it so easily, I understood the humour in the show in more than just the shallow laughs that my old classmates had when watching it. I'm still catching up on all the episodes to this date but I have to limit myself each day to a certain amount of episodes or I exhaust myself from laughter. So you can trust me when I say this, it takes a heightened (if not elite) sense of intelligence to even begin to comprehend just how funny this show is.
